segment.source: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks
segment.target: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks

segment.source: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks
segment.target: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks

segment.source: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks
segment.target: Configuring MED-V for Remote Networks

segment.source: You can configure MED-V to work from inside a network, remotely, or both from inside the network and remotely.
segment.target: You can configure MED-V to work from inside a network, remotely, or both from inside the network and remotely.

segment.source: To configure MED-V to work from inside a network
segment.target: To configure MED-V to work from inside a network

segment.source: Configure a MED-V server and image distribution inside the network.
segment.target: Configure a MED-V server and image distribution inside the network.

segment.source: To configure MED-V to work remotely
segment.target: To configure MED-V to work remotely

segment.source: Configure a MED-V server and an image distribution server that are accessible from the Internet.
segment.target: Configure a MED-V server and an image distribution server that are accessible from the Internet.

segment.source: If needed, configure a perimeter network (also called a DMZ) reverse proxy.
segment.target: If needed, configure a perimeter network (also called a DMZ) reverse proxy.

segment.source: Set the authentication method, in the ClientSettings.xml file, which can be found in the ServersConfiguration Server folder.
segment.target: Set the authentication method, in the ClientSettings.xml file, which can be found in the ServersConfiguration Server folder.

segment.source: To configure MED-V to work both from inside a network and remotely
segment.target: To configure MED-V to work both from inside a network and remotely

segment.source: Configure a MED-V server and image distribution server inside the network.
segment.target: Configure a MED-V server and image distribution server inside the network.

segment.source: Ensure that the servers are accessible from the Internet.
segment.target: Ensure that the servers are accessible from the Internet.

segment.source: Configure the DNS resolution so that when the client attempts to connect to a server, it automatically connects to the correct server (within the network or over the Internet) based on the client location.
segment.target: Configure the DNS resolution so that when the client attempts to connect to a server, it automatically connects to the correct server (within the network or over the Internet) based on the client location.

segment.source: If needed, configure a perimeter network reverse proxy.
segment.target: If needed, configure a perimeter network reverse proxy.

segment.source: Set the authentication method, in the ClientSettings.xml file, which can be found in the ServersConfiguration Server folder.
segment.target: Set the authentication method, in the ClientSettings.xml file, which can be found in the ServersConfiguration Server folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When applying new settings, the service must be restarted.
segment.target: When applying new settings, the service must be restarted.

segment.source: You can change the IIS authentication scheme to one of the following: BASIC, DIGEST, NTLM, or NEGOTIATE.
segment.target: You can change the IIS authentication scheme to one of the following: BASIC, DIGEST, NTLM, or NEGOTIATE.

segment.source: The default is NEGOTIATE and uses the following entry:
segment.target: The default is NEGOTIATE and uses the following entry:
